message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with the problem of recovering under-sampled sparse signals from corrupted observations, which is a common problem in signal processing and image analysis. The proposed algorithm is based on the generalized approximate message passing (GAMP) framework, which is a popular method for solving such problems. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.SP (Signal Processing) are the most likely sub-categories. 

The paper also discusses the use of the proposed algorithm for image analysis tasks, such as non-negative sparse coding of local image patches and image classification. This suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

The paper introduces a new formulation of the probability distribution for the sparse signal, which is a Bernoulli-Exponential mixture (BEm) distribution. This suggests that the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.MM (Multimedia).
